articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Greets Pakistani PM
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Greets Pakistani PM
Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Sunday sent a congratulatory message to Shahid Khaqan Abbasi on his election as prime minister of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan.
					 Expressing belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the peoples of the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished the prime minister bigger success in his work.
					
					 On the same day, DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho sent a similar message to Khawaja Muhammad Asif on his appointment as foreign minister of Pakistan.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- A Japan-DPRK friendship educational interchange delegation led by Michio Sano and other foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sunday.
					 They paid homage to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues at the palace.
					
					 They paid high tribute to the great leaders in the halls where they lie in state.
					
					 Then they went round the halls where the orders the great leaders received are on display and the halls which house the cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them for their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces Park Geun Hye Group's Shameless Plot
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces Park Geun Hye Group's Shameless Plot
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The Park Geun Hye group of south Korea did not send to the Archives data on criminal records during the period of its office including the data related to the case of "abuse of power" in state affairs and ferry Sewol disaster but scrapped en masse them, according to a south Korean media report. Nearly half of the documents of the preceding regime in the Archives are odds and ends such as data on the operation of dining hall for Chongwadae employees and there is no datum on day's routine of the "president", the report said, adding that it is impossible to bring to light the crimes of the Park Geun Hye group even though the "records of the president" are made public with the passage of the time.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 It is another organized crime which was committed on the direct order of traitor Park, a despicable trick to bury into oblivion all crimes she committed during her office.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye group of traitors has so far left no means untried to cover up their criminal acts, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 An evil deed will be discovered. The reckless moves of the group of traitors only prove that they are afraid of the disclosure of their records in the ruling period.
					
					 Through the recent case, south Koreans of all social standings are clearly realizing once again that the Park group of traitors are heinous criminals to be severely punished.
					
					 The south Korean people will bring to light the heinous criminal acts to the last and the Park group of traitors will pay high price for their crimes, though they may resort to sleight of hand.

articles.title: U.S. Should Pay Heed to DPRK's Warning: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Should Pay Heed to DPRK's Warning: Rodong Sinmun 
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The success in the second test-fire simulating the maximum range of ICBM Hwasong-14 was the stern warning the DPRK sent to the U.S. recklessly vociferating about nonsense.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday states in a commentary.
					
					 The U.S. ruling quarters should have been prudent after pondering over the great meaning of a "gift" sent by the DPRK on "America Independence Day", if they had some perception, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 However, the foolish Trump group described the great success of the DPRK's test-fire of ICBM, which laid a strong support for peace and security in the Korean peninsula, region and the rest of the world, as "threat to the world." They hysterically claimed "worldwide act" against the DPRK in defiance of opposition of the international community, making desperate efforts to impose the toughest sanctions and pressure and military threat and blackmail upon the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. was also given the big "gift package" by the DPRK meaning a stern warning.
					
					 The Trump group talked about "strong measure" in a bid to save the face of superpower. However, they put the U.S. on the cliff of the final destruction.
					
					 The world clearly sees that the American empire fall down like "a giant of mud" in the face of the indomitable spirit of Juche Korea which is always meeting challenges with proactive tactics. The world believes that the day is near at hand when the illegal anti-DPRK "sanctions resolutions" cooked up by the U.S. by abusing the UN Security Council will be on the shelf of history as legacies of the old international order.
					
					 The only option for the U.S. excepting repealing its bankrupt hostile policy toward the DPRK is self-destruction.

articles.title: Victory Belongs to DPRK Thanks to Kim Jong Un: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Victory Belongs to DPRK Thanks to Kim Jong Un: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The world is seething over the continuous successes of the test-launch of the ICBM Hwasong-14 in the DPRK.
					 Voices praising respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un are being heard from different parts of the world as he stroke terror into the U.S. boasting of being the "only superpower" and changed the world political structure through the two successful test-launches of ICBM Hwasong-14.
					
					 A lot of personages and organizations of the world's political and social circles are raising their voices praising the peerlessly great man. Voices of admiration for Kim Jong Un are ringing out even in the hostile country U.S. as he put the independent dignity of the country and national power on the highest level and brought about a great change in the world political circles challenging the "only superpower".
					
					 This is the clear proof of the highly strengthened overall national power and strategic position of the DPRK, Minju Joson on Sunday says in a commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 No matter how frantically the U.S. escalates the moves to stifle DPRK, the U.S. can never prevent the army and people of the DPRK from advancing along the road of independence, Songun and socialism chosen by themselves, united close around the great illustrious commander.
					
					 The Korean army and people, keeping in mind the honor of holding illustrious commander of Mt Paektu Kim Jong Un, who is admired by the world, will put an end to the U.S. persistent moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK and surely build the socialist country on this land, the most powerful country envied by the world.

articles.title: S. Korean Local Court Decides to Ban Publication of "Reminiscences" of Chun Doo Hwan
articles.content:
S. Korean Local Court Decides to Ban Publication of "Reminiscences" of Chun Doo Hwan
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The Kwangju Local Court of south Korea decided to ban the "reminiscences" written by traitor Chun Doo Hwan from being published and distributed, the book which totally denied the crime related to the Kwangju massacres, according to the south Korean CBS on August 4.
					 The book distorts the Kwangju popular uprising as "riot" and "rebellion", insists on "intervention of north's special unit into Kwangju incident" and denies the firing at the uprisers by helicopters and "martial law army", inviting strong backlash from different circles of south Korea.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop Treachery
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop Treachery
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean ruling quarters' anti-reunification and confrontation moves will face bitterer condemnation of the public and finally meet the same disgraceful end with that of the conservative group of traitors, Rodong Sinmun Sunday warns in an article.
					 The article says:
					
					 The south Korean authorities, frightened at the news of the successful second test-fire of ICBM Hwasong-14, made a great fuss, holding a consultative meeting with the U.S. and Japan and begging surrounding countries for cooperation in tightening sanctions on the DPRK. The chief executive gave an instruction on "examining independent sanctions against the north" without any calculation about consequences.
					
					 The hostile forces should clearly know that sanctions and pressure can never work on the DPRK.
					
					 Tragic is that the present south Korean authorities fail to understand that their criminal confrontation scheme through anti-DPRK sanctions with the backing of outsiders will be led to their own destruction.
					
					 They should remember the miserable fate of the preceding "government", which went bankrupt due to its persistent anti-DPRK sanctions racket.
					
					 The reality goes to prove that sycophantic treachery and confrontation policy is a despicable crime and foolish deed of inviting self-destruction.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should ponder over the consequences to be entailed by their confrontation racket pursuant to the U.S. anti-DPRK policy.

articles.title: Environmental Degradation by U.S. Troops in S. Korea
articles.content:
Environmental Degradation by U.S. Troops in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean CBS on August 1 disclosed the crimes of environmental degradation by the U.S. troops in south Korea.
					 It denounced that the U.S. troops polluted the soil, underground water and other environments in their bases and evaded the blame, and went on:
					
					 In the Ryongsan U.S. military base, oil leakage cases have occurred 84 times since 1993, causing serious environmental degradation.

articles.title: Seminar on Juche Idea Held in Uganda
articles.content:
Seminar on Juche Idea Held in Uganda
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- A Ugandan national seminar on the Juche idea for unity and development of Africa took place in Kampala on July 28.
					 On display at its venue were works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un and books introducing the DPRK.
					
					 Attending the seminar were personages of the government, organizations and institutions of Uganda and the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and masses.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket at the portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il before paying tribute to them.
					
					 A congratulatory speech was made at the seminar to be followed by a report and speeches.
					
					 Henry Masiko, director general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche idea, expressed expectation that the seminar would serve as a significant gathering conducive to unity and development of Africa and an important occasion in extending support and solidarity to the Korean people.
					
					 Mayambala Lawrence, chairman of the Ugandan National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, in a report said that the DPRK turned into a socialist state independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence and a politico-ideological and military power under the guidance of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and that miracles are being wrought in building a socialist power in the DPRK under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Daniel Rugarama, chairman of the Ugandan National Executive Committee of the Pan-African Movement, said that the DPRK has turned into a satellite manufacturer and launcher and a nuclear power despite the U.S. moves to stifle the DPRK, adding that Africa should learn from the DPRK's spirit of self-reliance and self-development.
					
					 Andre Lohekele Kalonda, secretary general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, stressed that the Songun politics of the DPRK is a mode of politics the African countries should follow, saying that if any country lacks power, it will become a plaything of the imperialists and it will be impossible to defend the destiny of its people and independence.
					
					 The second deputy prime minister of Uganda said it is thanks to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who founded and developed in depth the Juche idea and to the leadership of Kim Jong Un that the DPRK has emerged a politico-ideological power possessed of nukes and ICBM.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants of Int'l Seminar
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants of Int'l Seminar
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The participants of the Ugandan national seminar on the Juche idea for unity and development of Africa sent a letter to respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un on July 28.
					 Noting that they more keenly realized through epochal events in the DPRK the undying exploits HE Kim Il Sung, the founder and eternal President of the DPRK, and leader Kim Jong Il performed by laying a strong foundation for the cause of building a power, the letter said:
					
					 HE Marshal Kim Jong Un consolidated the strategic position of the DPRK in the world political arena and fully demonstrated the might of Juche Korea.
					
					 The present situation where the confrontation and conflict are festering due to the moves of big powers seeking to increase their influence and domination in various regions of the world requires holding aloft the banner of independence.
					
					 The participants of the seminar will do their bit in the struggle to build independent, united and prospering Africa and continue intensifying the study and dissemination of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					
					 The just cause of the DPRK and the struggle of the world revolutionary people advancing under the banner of the Juche idea are sure to win.
